intro: Amaracus tomentosus, commonly known as the woolly amaracus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, woolly foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers a sunny to partially shaded environment. Amaracus tomentosus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in temperate climates.
